>So said David on 2003-07-22 --------------------
>Dear Members,
>
>I whoul=
d like to test a class with a main(String[] args) method. Depending
>on the=
 input argument it executes one thing or the other. The problem is
>that on=
 my main(String[] args) method at the end or when it founds an
>error,
>the=
 method System.exit() is invoked. So when I define jUnit test cases
>(metho=
ds with prefix test), jUnits only runs the first test, because some
>System=
.exit() was invoked.
>
>Is there any way to test such kind of situations?

=
1. Do not use System.exit().
2. If you must use System.exit():

- Create a =
new method on your class called go(String[] args) {...}
- Move code from ma=
in() into go(), but leave the System.exit() call in main()
- Change main() =
to call go()
- Test go(); not main()
